channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road sunken by crossing in harrow manor way, 19th February
item.description:
Res has reported that by the zebra crossing as you turn into harrow manor way, the road has badly sunken and this is causing damage to peoples cars. Please can this be looked into asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harrow Manorway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roudabout, loudoun road zebra crossing, 19th February
item.description:

item.title: Road sunken on round about yarnton way/harrow manor way, 19th February
item.description:
Coming from yarnton way to harrow manor way there is a bit of road by the round about that is sunken very badley. This needs to be looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A2041, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fouling - on the pavement on the entire street, 19th February
item.description:
I am writing to report an ongoing issue with dog fouling on the public pavement outside my property on Hervey Road, Blackheath, SE3. The fouling is often left directly outside my gate and along the full stretch of pavement in front of my home. As I have children, this raises hygiene concerns and makes it unpleasant when entering and leaving the property. On several occasions, I have cleaned the area myself in order to ensure it is safe, especially as The Pointers School children regularly walk down this street to access their playing field. However, as this appears to be a recurring issue, I would be grateful if the matter could be looked into and if any appropriate measures, such as patrols or signage, could be considered. Please could you confirm receipt of this email and provide a reference number for the report? I would also appreciate an indication of the next steps or expected timeframe for review. Thank you for your assistance.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hervey Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain water gully sunken on bronze age way, 19th February
item.description:
Res has reported that there is a sunken rain water gully on bronze agwe way leading from the fish round about to the horse round about. This just before you go under the footbridge by the first turn off on bronze age way. This has been there around 2 months and it has been reported before but the issue still remains. Please can someone attend to this urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the Queens Head and Artichoke pub, 19th February
item.description:
200 yards worth of road is not road worthy. This road has been a nuisance and causing cars damage for over 2 years and nothing has been done, just keep dismissing the issues. Cyclists have fallen on the horrible road surface and cars cannot go without being jolted due to the unacceptable road surface Works have been done on the road somewhere else on 4 occasions for no reason but this horrible patch has been left out each time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Albany Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lighting on the communal area, 19th February
item.description:
I would like to report that in Ringside Court outside main bin room 1 light is not working. In a block B(next to water pump room)on the 5th floor outside flat 57 one light is not working and one between flats 56 -57,also one light is broken outside communal door on the balcony. On the 3rd floor outside flats:32,33,34,35,36 five lights are not working and between flats 32-33 one light is faulty as well. In block C(fire exit)on 2nd floor three lights are not working. In the block D(flats 24-27) on the ground floor at the door to the garden above electrical cupboard one light is not working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Outside houses 5 - 8, 19th February
item.description:
This whole patch of road has been defective for over 2 years - Yet have done nothing but keep it getting worse and is now utterly shameful The whole patch is at an unacceptably level and it's horrible to drive on, it's causing damage to cars, the suspension and tyres. There are cars and bicycles going into the opposite lane to drive better. Why are you letting things get this bad? You need to resurface the road and sort it out immediately. This is a serious safety issue for both cars and cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Albert Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Really large pothole previously filled, 19th February
item.description:
I think this has already been reported (FixMyStreet ref: 8844446) but it seems your contractors ran out of tarmac or something. It's been HALF filled but it's still a major crater there, exactly where cycles need to go over which is a major hazard to us. Please fix properly. Thank you!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highbury Corner, Highbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
